clean_text: Finally, recent research on analyzing online social media shown a growing interest in mining news stories and headlines because of its broad applications ranging from "meme" tracking and spike detection (Leskovec et al., 2009) to text summarization (Barzilay and McKeown, 2005).

raw_text: The pioneering work on fusion is Barzilayand McKeown (2005), which introduces the frame work used by subsequent projects: they represent the inputs by dependency trees, align some words to merge the input trees into a lattice, and then extract a single, connected dependency tree as the output
clean_text: The pioneering work on fusion is Barzilay and McKeown (2005), which introduces the frame work used by subsequent projects: they represent the inputs by dependency trees, align some words to merge the input trees into a lattice, and then extract a single, connected dependency tree as the output.

citing_paper_authors: Hideki, Tanaka | Akinori, Kinoshita | Takeshi, Kobayakawa | Tadashi, Kumano | Naoto, Katoh
raw_text: Barzilay and McKeown (2005) proposed an idea called sentence fusion that integrates information in overlapping sentences to produce a non overlapping summary sentence
clean_text: Barzilay and McKeown (2005) proposed an idea called sentence fusion that integrates information in overlapping sentences to produce a non-overlapping summary sentence.

clean_text: Either a sentences from the cluster is selected (Aliguliyev, 2006) or a new sentence is regenerated from all/some sentences in a cluster (Barzilay and McKeown, 2005).

raw_text: Recent abstractive approaches, such as sentence compression (Knight and Marcu, 2000) (Cohn and Lapata, 2009) and sentence fusion (Barzilay and McKeown, 2005) or revision (Tanaka et al, 2009) have focused on rewriting techniques, without consideration for a complete model which would include a transition to an abstract representation for content selection
clean_text: Recent abstractive approaches, such as sentence compression (Knight and Marcu, 2000) (Cohn and Lapata, 2009) and sentence fusion (Barzilay and McKeown, 2005) or revision (Tanaka et al, 2009) have focused on rewriting techniques, without consideration for a complete model which would include a transition to an abstract representation for content selection.

raw_text: The work of (Barzilay and McKeown, 2005) on sentence fusion shows an example of re-using the same syntactical structure of a source sentence to create a new one with a slightly different meaning
clean_text: The work of (Barzilay and McKeown, 2005) on sentence fusion shows an example of re-using the same syntactical structure of a source sentence to create a new one with a slightly different meaning.

citing_paper_authors: Stephen, Wan | Robert, Dale | Mark, Dras | Cécile L., Paris
raw_text: The work of Barzilay and McKeown (2005) on Sentence Fusion introduced the problem of converting multiple sentences into a single summary sen 545tence
clean_text: The work of Barzilay and McKeown (2005) on Sentence Fusion introduced the problem of converting multiple sentences into a single summary sentence.

raw_text: In our experiments, dependency parsing is accomplished with Minipar (Lin, 1998) and alignment is done using a bottom-up tree alignment algorithm (Barzilay and McKeown, 2005) modified to account for the shallow semantic role labels produced by the parser
clean_text: In our experiments, dependency parsing is accomplished with Minipar (Lin, 1998) and alignment is done using a bottom-up tree alignment algorithm (Barzilay and McKeown, 2005) modified to account for the shallow semantic role labels produced by the parser.

raw_text: Abstractive summarization has been explored to some extent in recent years: sentence compression (Knight and Marcu, 2000) (Cohn and Lapata, 2009), sentence fusion (Barzilay and McKeown, 2005) or revision (Tanaka et al, 2009), and a generation based approach that could be called sentence split ting (Genest and Lapalme, 2011)
clean_text: Abstractive summarization has been explored to some extent in recent years: sentence compression (Knight and Marcu, 2000) (Cohn and Lapata, 2009), sentence fusion (Barzilay and McKeown, 2005) or revision (Tanaka et al, 2009), and a generation based approach that could be called sentence splitting (Genest and Lapalme, 2011).

citing_paper_authors: Emiel, Krahmer | Erwin, Marsi | Paul, Pelt
raw_text: Sentence fusion is a text-to-text generation application, which given two related sentences, outputs a single sentence expressing the information shared by the two input sentences (Barzilay and McKeown 2005)
clean_text: Sentence fusion is a text-to-text generation application, which given two related sentences, outputs a single sentence expressing the information shared by the two input sentences (Barzilay and McKeown 2005).

citing_paper_authors: Emiel, Krahmer | Erwin, Marsi | Paul, Pelt
raw_text: Barzilay and McKeown (2005) argue convincingly that employing such a fusion strategy in a multi document summarization system can result in more informative and more coherent summaries. It should be noted, however, that there are multiple ways to fuse two sentences
clean_text: Barzilay and McKeown (2005) argue convincingly that employing such a fusion strategy in a multidocument summarization system can result in more informative and more coherent summaries.

citing_paper_authors: Kathleen R., McKeown | Sara, Rosenthal | Kapil, Thadani | Coleman, Moore
raw_text: In contrast to these approaches, sentence fusion was introduced to combine fragments of sentences with common information for multi-document summarization (Barzilayand McKeown, 2005)
clean_text: In contrast to these approaches, sentence fusion was introduced to combine fragments of sentences with common information for multi-document summarization (Barzilay and McKeown, 2005).
